history.content:
While I haven't taken those specific courses over the summer, I can comment in general of summer classes.

DISCLAIMER: These are just my opinions and may or may not reflect the actual truth

Pros

  • Normally students only take 1 technical course over the summer, so there is more time to focus on that 1 class and digest the material
  • Most extracurricular/club activities are halted in the summer, so there is also more time in that aspect
  • For upper division CS courses, there will be students in departments outside of EECS/CS enrolled (because in general that's the only time they can get into the courses). The grading curve could potentially be lower if those students aren't as strong of programmers.
  • Office Hours are less crowded which you NOW have the TIME to go to

Cons

  • Material is much faster (lectures almost every weekday), but there is really a lot of time during the summer you'd be surprised
  • Lecturers are usually grad/phD students or a visiting professor instead of an actual Berkeley professor
  • Students that usually TA the course, most likely are doing summer internships, so potentially the quality of the TA is lower

I was wondering what are the pros and cons of taking upper div CS classes like CS 160, CS 188, CS 189 in summer vs regular semester. It will be helpful if someone can comment in terms of  quality of the lectures, course material, exams, grades etc.
history.subject: Pros and Cons of taking upper div CS course in summer vs regular semester
